result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:20 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Mohamed F Zormati. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Court received information that the Defendant was recently moved to Dodge Correctional Facility, and a video appearance was not able to be set.  

Defense states that the Defendant was sentenced in Washington County to a prison sentence, about 3 weeks ago. Defense requests a status date for further investigation, and to review JOC on Washington County Case. 

Court will set further proceeding date.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Letter dated 10/21/2022, filed by Atty Gutierrez, requesting a Zoom appearance

9:04 AM Defendant Mohamed F Zormati appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Mohamed F Zormati.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense is reviewing discovery, and asks for another date. There is an investigation request pending as well. Defense has discovery but does not have an offer. 
State forwards offer to Defense. 

Defendant has a sentencing hearing on 09/29/2022 in Washington County. 
Court will set another hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Mohamed F Zormati in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Town of Oconomowoc police officer Timothy Patoka sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Brejcha.  Cross examination by Atty. Gutierrez.  Stae rests.  Testimony close.  Atty. Brejcha moves for bind over. Atty. Gutierrez objects to bind over and makes a closing statement.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

email confirmation from Washington co jail - courts to check back after 7/18 to see if he is still there or moved
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:34 PM Defendant Mohamed F Zormati appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Washington County Jail.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The defendant states he filled out some paperwork a couple days ago regarding an appointment of an attorney from the Public Defender's Office.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  The defendant to appear by Zoom from Washington County Jail at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Returned original warrant from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department for Mohamed F. Zormati issued on 02-16-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III.
Detainer placed at: Washington Co Jail and Fax Confirmation

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

02:16 PM Defendant Mohamed F Zormati in court by zoom video, in custody at Washington County Jail.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant has not received any information from the public defender's office.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
